title: Javautvecklare med lösningsarkitektur, krav- eller testkunskap
description:
Är du en skicklig systemutvecklare inom Java som också har erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur, kravhantering- och/eller testautomatisering? Tycker du om att ha ett jobb som räknas? Då måste du läsa vidare!
   

  

 Hos oss bidrar du till ett välfungerande samhälle för allmänhet och företag samtidigt som du får möjlighet att bidra och utveckla dina kunskaper! Kronofogden erbjuder ett modernt och hållbart arbetsliv där t.ex. distansarbete är en möjlighet i den omfattning verksamheten beslutar.
   

  

 Just nu anställer vi medarbetare i Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö och Kalmar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Vi är närmare 230 kollegor på Kronofogden som arbetar med IT-utveckling och vi har en spännande resa framför oss med modernisering, digitalisering och automatisering. Vi driver framåtriktade projekt och i fokus finns bland annat internetteknik, informationscentrisk syn, händelsedriven arkitektur (EDA) och moderna e-tjänster. Våra främsta framgångsfaktorer är att vi arbetar tillsammans i agila team med verksamheterna inom myndigheten.
   

  

 Som javautvecklare hos oss kommer du att ha omväxlande och utmanande arbetsuppgifter. Du arbetar dagligen i högt prioriterade och strategiskt viktiga it-system tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor som du delar ditt intresse för teknik med. Du kommer att vara med och utveckla nya system och vidareutveckla samt förvalta befintliga system. Vår nyutveckling görs i Spring Boot.
   

  

 Vår system- och informationsstruktur är komplex, med mycket integration där en del av systemen även är integrerade med andra myndigheter såsom Polisen, Försäkringskassan och Skatteverket. Här finns således goda möjligheter att utvecklas som systemutvecklare, men även möjlighet att prova andra roller inom it- organisationen.
   

  

 Alla som arbetar på Kronofogden bidrar till arbetet mot brott. I dina arbets­upp­gifter ingår att identifiera och förhindra försök till brottslighet samt underrätta andra myndigheter om misstänkta brott.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Som medarbetare på Kronofogden förväntas du leva upp till vår
   

  

 Du har personliga egenskaper som innebär att du är ansvarstagande, kreativ samt har förmåga att kommunicera och skapa goda relationer med kollegor och leverantörer. Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt, är noggrann och kvalitetsmedveten.
   

  

**Dina Kvalifikationer**
**Vi söker dig som har:**
* minst 4 års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet som java-utvecklare
* minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Spring Boot, v2 eller v3
* arbetslivserfarenhet av automatiserad testning, agil kravhantering och/eller lösningsarkitekt
* arbetslivserfarenhet av CI/CD
* goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* utbildning på minst gymnasienivå.


**Det Är Önskvärt Om Du Har**
* arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling baserat på Openshift Container Plattform eller annan Kubernetesbaserad plattform
* erfarenhet av JavaEE/JakartaEE och Weblogic Server eller JBoss
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med Angular, React eller liknande Frontend-ramverk
* erfarenhet av databas-hantering i JPA eller motsvarande baserat på relationsdatabas
* erfarenhet av agil kravhantering
* erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling.


**Om oss**
 Kronofogden är en statlig myndighet med ett viktigt uppdrag. Vi jobbar nära människor i utsatta situationer. Vi hjälper den som inte har fått betalt och vägleder den som ska betala. Vi ger medborgare och företag information och god service, så att de kan fatta långsiktiga och hållbara beslut. Det kräver kunskap, handlings­kraft, omtanke och mod. Vi bidrar till ett väl fungerande samhälle för allmänhet och företag – ett samhälle där skulder och andra krav blir fastställda och indrivna på ett rättssäkert sätt.
   

  

 Hos oss kan du räkna med utmanande arbetsuppgifter som även är utvecklande för dig. När du går hem från en dag på jobbet kan du vara säker på att du har gjort något som verkligen räknas – både för andra och för dig.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med provanställning i sex månader. Du blir anställd som IT handläggare. Kronofogden erbjuder möjlighet till distansarbete efter överenskommelse med arbetsgivaren.
   

  

 Att arbeta i staten innebär att du följer den statliga värdegrunden. Det ställs också särskilda krav på omdöme, säkerhetstänkande och att du följer gällande lagar. Vi ställer frågor vid intervju om tidigare eventuell brotts­lighet och brister i tidigare anställning. För slutkandidater ställs även dessa frågor till referenspersoner. Vi tar även in uppgifter om skulder registrerade hos Kronofogden, konkurs och närings­förbud. Framkomna uppgifter vägs in vid helhetsbedömningen av din lämplighet för den aktuella anställningen.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhets­prövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbets-uppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekry­teringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Lär känna oss bättre genom att följa oss på LinkedIn och besöka vår
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-08-29!

title: Experienced composite design engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



***Are you an experienced composite design engineer ready for your next challenge?***


***Do you have a passion for technology, several years of experience in composite design, and enjoy taking technical ownership? Then this could be the right opportunity for you!***


We are now looking for a senior composite design engineer for an assignment with one of our clients in the defense industry. You will play a key role in a cross-functional team, contributing both to technical development and team growth.





ABOUT THE ROLE



In this role, you will be responsible for the design and development of composite solutions – from concept to verified product. You’ll take technical leadership within the composite domain and help guide and support less experienced engineers.



You’ll collaborate closely with production, purchasing, materials, simulation, and mechanical design engineers in an environment driven by innovation and teamwork.





WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR



We believe you have:


* Several years of experience in composite design
* Strong knowledge in mechanical engineering
* Proficiency in Creo (CAD)
* Experience with PDM systems, preferably IFS
* A proactive mindset and the ability to take ownership
* Strong communication skills and enjoy working both independently and in teams.

**WHO ARE WE?**



As a consultant at Sigma Industry West, you get the best of both worlds: the variety and development of consulting – with the security of a stable, long-term employer. We provide cutting-edge expertise in areas like Product Development, UX & Design, PLM, Industrial IT, Production Technology, and Project Management. Your assignment may be at the client site or from our vibrant in-house office located in the heart of Lindholmen Science Park.



We believe in doing things together and value a healthy mix of work and fun – from afterworks, events, and workouts to ski trips and inspirational talks. We've taken many exciting trips together and just recently returned from South Africa(!) where we celebrated our 10th anniversary as a consultancy firm.



Competence development has always been a priority for us. In addition to learning in your assignments and various technical trainings, we offer internal programs for personal growth.



We also believe that autonomy, involvement, and influence are key to achieving your personal goals. Our employees have chosen us because we share this view on career, life, and development. To us, who you are is just as important as what you do. Our ambition is to help you grow and evolve into something great – together with our clients.



**Sigma Group**



As part of Sigma Group, we offer the best of both worlds: entrepreneurial spirit and long-term stability.



We’re the smaller company within the larger Sigma network – a group of companies with specialized expertise across different engineering fields. Today, we are over 5,000 employees in 14 countries, making us Sweden’s largest privately owned consulting group.



*We’re heading out for our summer break starting week 28, and the recruitment process will resume in week 33. You are more than welcome to submit your application already – we’ll get back to you as soon as we return from vacation.*



### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Sofia Nyquist,  

+46 733039915  

sofia.nyquist@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Experienced composite design engineer
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry West
* #### **LOCATION**


Göteborg, Sweden
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-07-08
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-09-30
* #### **CONTACT**


Sofia Nyquist, sofia.nyquist@sigma.se, +46733039915

title: Product Owner & Team Lead Embedded Systems (all genders)
description:
**Job Title:** Product Owner & Team lead - Embedded Systems (all genders)

**Location:** Munters, Kista

**Overview:**


At Munters, we are on a mission to shape a more sustainable world through innovative climate solutions. As we continue our digital transformation, we are looking for a **Product Owner & Team Lead for Embedded Systems (all genders)** to join our team in Kista.


This role position combines the responsibilities of a Product Owner—guiding embedded product development with a user-centric and platform-aligned approach—with team leadership responsibilities. You will lead a team of embedded system developers, and support the collaboration with other teams and stakeholders, and play a key role in team development, performance, and motivation.


This position offers a unique chance for someone who enjoys integrating strategic product management with direct leadership of a technical team

**Key Responsibilities:**

**As Product owner:**

* **Own and prioritize the backlog**


You will work closely with the Product Managers and Technical Product Managers to translate the product vision and roadmap into user stories and tasks, prioritize and deliver high-quality features while maintaining alignment with customer needs and technical feasibility.

* **Foster a collaborative team environment**
* Work closely with hardware and software developers, scrum master, UX/UI designers, and other stakeholders to build a cohesive team that thrives on open communication, trust, mutual respect, and shared goals. You should be able to handle and resolve disagreements constructively, ensuring that all team members are included and valued

* **Align with platform strategy**
* Prioritize embedded systems and platform improvements that directly impact product features or control system capabilities. Collaborate with line manager and embedded software developers to ensure platform development supports product development.

* **Product support & improvements**
* Handle and prioritize support cases escalated from the global service team — focusing on critical product issues and product improvements. Ensure timely resolution and clear communication with relevant stakeholders throughout the process.

* **Support production tools & testing**


Act as the main point of contact for the production team regarding the embedded control system, configuration tools, and end-of-line testing. Collect and assess their input and support needs, ensure clear communication on firmware releases, bug fixes, and tool updates, and prioritize their requirements in the product backlog. Collaborate closely with production to develop and improve tools and processes that support efficient and reliable manufacturing.

* **Drive timely and qualitative delivery**
* Collaborate with the Scrum Master role and the technical team to define user stories, ensure features are delivered on time, and meet expected quality standards.

* **Validate features and user needs**


Use feedback loops, testing, and analytics to evaluate feature effectiveness and guide backlog updates

**As a Team Lead:**

* **Lead and support the team**


Serves as the **day-to-day go-to person** for team members, providing coaching, support, helping resolve blockers, and regular development dialogues.

* **Foster a supportive culture**


Promote a psychologically safe and collaborative environment where team members recognize being engaged, heard, and empowered

* **Performance & competence development (in coordination with line manager)**


Gives regular feedback and guidance on performance and development needs.

* **Resource planning and recruitment (in coordination with line manager)**


Supporting with identifying resource needs, supporting recruitment and onboarding.

* **Act as a cultural role model**


Set a positive tone, promote cross-team alignment, and be a change agent during organizational transformation.

**Requirements:**

* Experience as a Product Owner or similar role in embedded systems or control systems
* Prior leadership experience or clear potential to take on formal people leadership.
* Thorough understanding of agile methodologies, Scrum
* Comprehensive understanding of embedded systems and their integration into product development
* Familiarity with **C/C++** and embedded development practices.
* Practical experience with Azure DevOps or Jira for backlog and sprint management
* Experience in embedded system development, including working with control systems and platform improvements.
* Analytical skills with a focus on technical product development and customer needs.
* Experience handling technical support cases and collaborating with technical teams to resolve issues efficiently.
* Skilled written and verbal communications skills in English
* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field

**Soft skills:**

* Effective communication skills with the ability to collaborate across hardware, software, and business teams
* Ability to actively listen to feedback from the team, customers, and stakeholders, and use this input to adjust the product direction when needed.
* Ability to collaborate in a diverse and cross-functional work environment to ensure alignment and that everyone is working toward the same objectives.
* Help create a productive environment that motivates team members to collaborate and share their knowledge
* Ability to make informed decisions on which features to prioritize based on business needs, user value, and technical resources is essential. This requires a balance between making quick decisions and remaining responsive to feedback and data.
* Lead the team through disagreements to align on ways of working within the team as well as with other stakeholders
* Be able to inspire the team by clearly conveying the product vision in a compelling way that encourages engagement and motivation
* Be able to make sound decisions even when not all facts are available, and act as a stable leader when the team is facing challenges.
* Skilled at balancing short-term delivery and long-term goals.
company_description: Munters is a global leader in climate control solutions for mission-critical processes.

title: UX Lead
description:
Telness Tech is on a mission to simplify and digitize the telecom industry. Our platform powers next-generation mobile providers—from traditional MVNOs to eSIM challengers and non-telecom brands embedding connectivity. With our roots in Stockholm and global ambitions, we’re building the future of telecom: fast, flexible, and customer-first.


We’re looking for a UX Lead to ensure our platform remains intuitive and impactful as we scale across markets and user types.


**About the role**

As UX Lead at Telness Tech, you’ll shape our end-to-end product experience -bringing clarity to complexity and ensuring our platform is intuitive for customers, operators, and end-users. You’ll work closely with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to design thoughtful, scalable solutions to technically complex problems.  

  

You’ll drive the design process from discovery to delivery, combining hands-on design with strategic leadership and contributing directly to high-impact product initiatives. You’ll be instrumental in aligning design with product strategy, evolving our design system, and embedding user-centric thinking into every stage of development.


**In this role, you will:**

* Own design strategy across products—balancing usability, scalability, and brand consistency.
* Design end-to-end flows and interfaces for complex systems with multiple user types.
* Partner with the CPO and PMs to explore, learn, and shape a forward-thinking product strategy that keeps us ahead of the market.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to align design with business goals and technical constraints.
* Lead and mentor a small design team, fostering a collaborative and high-performing team.
* Iterate based on feedback and data to continuously improve the user experience.

**What you bring to the table:**

* 8+ years of experience in product design with a strong emphasis on UX.
* A track record of designing intuitive solutions for complex products with multiple user types.
* Experience in high-growth product or SaaS environments; startup experience is a plus.
* Proven leadership experience, including mentoring and leading other designers.
* Expert proficiency in Figma and managing shared design systems.
* Skilled in user research, usability testing, and turning insights into actionable design.
* Able to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Comfortable balancing business goals with user needs to drive product success.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with high proficiency in English.

**Why Telness Tech?**

We’re not building for telco as it is—we’re building for how it should be: fast-moving, easy to use, and built for the people who use it. At Telness Tech, you’ll join a curious, ambitious, and transparent team. We work hard, we move fast, and we support each other every step of the way.


Here’s what you can expect:


* Be part of an exciting startup journey with strong funding and international expansion.
* Play an active role in building one of the telecom industry’s most innovative companies.
* A high-trust, high-autonomy environment where you’ll be encouraged to take ownership and explore growth opportunities for both Telness Tech and your development.
* A friendly, positive, and supportive workplace that fosters collaboration and constructive challenge.
* Complimentary daily breakfast, regular "Friday" AWs, and fun activities!
* Hybrid/remote work setup with an office in central Stockholm.

Sounds like your challenge? Let’s talk.


*Currently, we are not able to offer relocation or visa sponsorship.*

title: Senior Business Development Director
description:
***This is us***
  

At Avenga, we believe that human creativity empowers technology that matters. Operating globally, our 6000+ specialists provide a full spectrum of services, including business and tech advisory, enterprise solutions, CX, UX and Ul design, managed services, product development, and software development.


***This is the job***
  

As a Senior Business Development Director at Avenga your main focus will be nurturing, expanding and attracting key clients in Sweden, Nordics and selected strategic global accounts. With a background in IT and Sales you understand the industry and the complexity of selling comprehensive bespoke software solutions, projects and consultancy. The role will involve both nurturing current relationships and seeking out new ones with a consultative selling approach.


You’ll find yourself in an environment where you can influence the way we work and make the difference. That is why it involves a high level of collaboration with Pre-sales teams, Delivery, Engineering, Marketing and well as with the ELT member on the go-to market strategies. The role includes operational aspects such as continuous dialogue with new and existing clients regarding pre-sales, quotas, business development account planning, and coordination with delivery. But also attending different sales events and working strategically with the marketing team.


***This is you***
  

You consider yourself to be a socially skilled and autonomous person who’s experienced in consultative selling in the Tech and Consultancy industry. You have a proven track-record of similar roles where you’ve been working with big clients within the IT-industry in Sweden, Nordics and/or Global markets, it’s also a big plus if you’re used to working with clients within the Retail and HiTech industry.


With your experience in account management, you know how to handle key accounts and understand driving values through the tailored business development routines that come with it. Since we’re an international organization it’s also a plus if you’re accustomed to working in such and know how to utilize the strength and benefits that come with it.


**Skills:**


* You should be comfortable applying consultative selling approach within daily business development routines
* You’re used to working in both Swedish and English, spoken and written, since this is an international organization
* Proven track-record from similar roles within the IT-industry, preferably within IT-consultancy
* Handling and developing communications and partnership with different stakeholders within customer organization including C-levels
* Proven track-record from working with international clients as well as the ones in the Nordics
* Experienced in handling and nurturing big clients and projects
* Knowledge and experience in Information technology systems analysis and maintenance

***What awaits you at Avenga?***
  

Through our values, Better Minds, Bolder Ideas and Bigger Hearts, we strive to provide you with the tools, the autonomy, the trust, and assistance you need to excel. Enjoy benefits like private health insurance, well-being programs, flexible and hybrid work models, laptops and gear, trainings, language classes, social events, great offices, and more.
  

  

*We take pride in the diverse skills and character of our teams, welcoming everyone to apply and contribute to our collective strength.*
  

  

*We process the applications on an ongoing basis, which could mean that the process ends before the final application date, so don't wait to apply.*
company_description: Avenga is an international consultancy and technology solutions partner with 6000+ specialists globally.

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Training and Support
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an 6-month Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 




  




* Be involved in all stages of the design process within projects; from research, workshops, idea generation, concepts to prototypes and delivery of design.
* Create interaction design through customer journeys, sketches, wireframes and prototypes based on insights.
* Use creative tools like Figma and other suitable design software in the XR space.
* Conducting deep interviews and workshops for user research and product testing.
* Monitor and design the interface for head-mounted XR glasses and how the user should integrate with the software (e.g. Hand movements, eye tracking, etc.)



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 




  




* Previous of relevant work experience in UX/UI and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* An ability to choose the tools and methods that best suit each specific situation.
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Proficient in Figma
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design and marketing.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially

title: Junior Product Designer
description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
   

  

 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.
* Find, together with engineers, the most efficient trade-off between high-value solutions for users and the complexity of implementation.
* Leverage usage data to evaluate the impact of your designs, and apply your learnings to the next iterations.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We're extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don't hesitate to apply.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: Junior Product Manager
description:
**Job Description**
 Junior Product Manager
   

  

**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 As a Junior Product Manager at Worldline, you will work closely with the Lead Product Manager and our development team to support strategic initiatives and manage day-to-day product activities. You will assist in driving the development of our digital onboarding solutions, helping improve customer experience and operational efficiency. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in product management, stakeholder alignment, and market research, while also independently leading smaller projects.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
* Assist the Lead Product Manager on strategic development projects, contributing ideas and executing specific tasks.
* Support in stakeholder management by facilitating communication between internal teams
* Monitor product performance metrics and analyze data to identify improvement opportunities.
* Conduct market and user research to gather insights and inform product decisions.
* Create documentation including user stories, product backlogs, and requirements specifications.
* Plan, execute, and manage small independent projects related to digital onboarding
* Collaborate with engineering, design, and other departments to ensure successful delivery of features.


**Who Are We Looking For**
 You are structured, possess exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, and enjoy using your creativity to tackle challenges. Seeing the big picture while maintaining attention to detail comes naturally to you. You thrive in a global, multicultural environment, and your flexibility allows you to adapt quickly to shifting tasks and priorities in a fast-paced setting. On top of that, you have:
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance, Technology, or related field.
* Strong analytical skills and data-driven mindset.
* Excellent communication skills and full professional proficiency in English
* Ability to work independently and take ownership of small projects.
* Previous experience of project management, or related roles is a plus.
* Interest in digital payments


**What We Offer**
* An engaging and dynamic work environment within the fintech industry.
* Opportunities for growth and professional development in product management.
* Collaborative team culture with a focus on innovation and customer impact.
* The chance to contribute to shaping payment solutions in the Nordics.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

 Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com
   

  

 You can also meet some of our colleagues and see the Stockholm office here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FzRROdZETOE
   

  

 We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Junior Frontend Engineer for Portfolio Brands
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Junior Frontend Engineer, you will be an essential part of our software engineering team. This role is perfect for recent graduates or individuals with 1-2 years of experience who are eager to work on exciting projects and learn from experienced engineers. Showcasing your programming skills, problem solving abilities, and willingness to learn is key.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 
  

  

* Help design, develop, test, and maintain software solutions under the guidance of senior developers.
* Work with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and contribute to refining specifications.
* Contribute to a customer-facing web application used across several fashion brands.
* Work with headless CMSs, design systems, and other SaaS integrations.
* Engage in code reviews to learn best practices and improve your coding skills and team discussions, and knowledge-sharing sessions.
* Assist in identifying and resolving defects in existing applications.
* Learn about emerging technologies and tools to enhance your skills.
* Utilize mentorship, professional publications, and networking to improve your job competence.
* Strive for excellence and quality in delivering solutions that satisfy customer requirements.
* Demonstrate a positive attitude and dedication to learning and contributing to the team.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Portfolio Brands Engineering is part of Business Tech within H&M group and supports technical development for our
 **Portfolio Brands - COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, and ARKET** 
 . We are on a journey to implement the latest innovative solutions, offering seamless navigation, personalized recommendations, and an immersive browsing experience. We leverage advanced technologies to ensure a fast, secure, and user-friendly interface, allowing customers to explore our curated collections effortlessly. Our commitment to excellence drives us to continuously enhance our digital storefront and ensure that our customers experience an exceptional online shopping journey.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with...
   

  

* At least 1-2 years' experience working as a junior software engineer with strong front-end focus, particularly with Hands-on experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, and Nice to have Next.js.
* Applicable relevant qualification in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
* A portfolio, GitHub profile, or examples of previous projects – whether academic, personal, or freelance.
* Basic understanding of software development principles, algorithms, data structures, and design patterns.
* Basic understanding of Github and CI/CD.
* Strive for excellence and quality in delivering solutions that satisfy customer requirements.
* Staying updated on emerging technology trends like API strategy, event-driven architecture, and cloud computing to contribute effectively to evolving technology strategies.
* Interest in e-commerce, user-facing products, or building accessible and responsive interfaces.


 And people who are…
   

  

* Excellent at problem-solving and have a keen eye for detail.
* Collaborative and willing to ask questions.
* Excellent in English communication , Self driven.
* Responsible, work proactively and continuously improve.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* Staff discount card: Usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* H&M Incentive Program (HIP): Included in our HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* Competitive pensions: Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to the Swedish market.
* Generous vacation: 30 day's vacation, health care allowance, and good work-life balance.
* Additional perks: Discounts from Benify.
* Innovative Environment: Work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
* Global Impact: Be part of a team that influences users worldwide.
* Professional Growth: Endless opportunities to learn and develop your skills.
* Collaborative Culture: Join a motivated team that values collaboration and excellence.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: iOS Developer
description:
Are you passionate about crafting intuitive, high-performance mobile experiences? Do you want to contribute to a product that empowers millions of investors with direct access to company narratives and insights? Join us as an iOS Developer at
 **Quartr** 
 , where you'll play a pivotal role in enhancing our top-rated mobile app, delivering seamless access to investor relations materials from 13,000+ public companies worldwide.
   

  

**About The Mobile Team**
 Quartr's Mobile team is dedicated to developing engaging and reliable mobile experiences that bring clarity to the complexities of financial markets. We collaborate closely with design, product, and other engineering teams to deliver features that are both elegant and high-performing. Joining our team means tackling exciting engineering challenges in user experience, streaming, and backend-for-frontend development.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain the Quartr iOS app using Swift, SwiftUI, and UIKit
* Build smooth, accessible, and high-performing user interfaces
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Designers, Product Managers, and other Engineers
* Troubleshoot issues and ensure the app runs flawlessly at scale
* Contribute to backend-for-frontend systems designed specifically for mobile
* Stay on top of iOS trends and advocate for best practices within the team
* Engage in code reviews and continuously raise the quality of our codebase


**What Will Help You Succeed**
* 3+ years of experience in iOS development
* Proficient in Swift and frameworks like SwiftUI, UIKit, AVKit/AVFoundation
* Solid understanding of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines
* Experience with iOS testing frameworks such as XCTest
* Collaborative mindset and excellent communication skills in a remote team setting
* Experience working with TypeScript/JavaScript backends is a big plus
* Bonus: Android development knowledge, CI/CD pipeline experience, or use of AI development tools
* Eagerness to take ownership and contribute across different parts of the stack


**Note** 
 : You need to be based in
 **Sweden** 
 with a valid work permit. We are
 **not** 
 looking for consultants or recruitment agency assistance.
   

  

**Why join Quartr?**
* Do your life's work We focus passionately on doing things with very high quality across our entire organization.
* Join the foundational team We are still in the very early innings of what we believe to be a multi-decade journey.
* Remote-first culture Work from where you are most productive—remotely, or from our offices in central Gothenburg or Stockholm.
* Skin in the game Every employee receives qualified stock options to share in our collective success.
* Competitive salary & options We offer a compensation package that reflects the caliber of people we hire.
* Wellness allowance We encourage health and balance with a generous wellness allowance.


**About Quartr**
 Every day, leading companies and financial institutions worldwide rely on Quartr to make better decisions faster. The product suite includes: Quartr API, enabling third parties to build custom solutions powered by Quartr's unique live earnings calls and transcription technology and its extensive global database of IR material – including public company filings, archived earnings call transcripts, and slide deck presentations. Quartr Pro, a desktop research platform that increases efficiency and precision in qualitative public market research for top hedge funds, asset managers, equity research departments, and IR professionals. A free mobile app allowing users to always stay informed and conduct research anytime, anywhere.
   

  

 Learn more about Quartr
   

  

 Our partnership with Perplexity
   

  

 Quartr secures Investment from Altos Ventures partnering with respected San Fransisco-based VC firm to further accelerate growth and continue transforming qualitative market research
   

  

 Fourth Most Innovative Company in Personal Finance 2024 as recognized by Fast Company

title: Product Manager - Svea Solar
description:
Svea Solar is revolutionizing energy management, helping customers optimize their use while on a mission to build a fossil-free future. With 50,000+ customers and over a decade of experience, we deliver smart energy solutions for homes and businesses
 



 .
 



 We are now looking for a
 **Product Manager** 
 to join our team focused on
 **Virtual Power Plants (VPP)** 
 - one of the most innovative and fast-growing areas within the energy sector!
 



  





**What is a Virtual Power Plant?** 




 A Virtual Power Plant (VPP) connects solar panels, batteries, and EVs into one intelligent system that supports the energy grid by balancing supply and demand in real time. At Svea Solar, our VPP empowers households to take part in the energy market, optimize energy use, and drive the shift to a better future.
 



  





 Our VPP team leads this transformation, building the software and systems that turn data and distributed energy assets into real impact. Read more about our VPP here.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As our Product Manager, you will lead the development and own the roadmap for of our VPP offering. This is a highly collaborative role where you’ll align stakeholders, manage competing priorities, and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment. You’ll have a direct impact on Svea Solar’s mission to accelerate the transition to renewable energy, helping to shape how households and businesses participate in the energy system of the future.
 



 You’ll report to our Chief Product Officer, Joakim Grönvall.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Develop and lead the strategy to maximize revenue for customers and Svea Solar by optimizing when and how our assets support grid stabilization across Nordic markets
* Identify, prioritize, and validate product opportunities aligned with team and company goals
* Define and communicate a clear product vision, translating it into an actionable roadmap
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, design, analytics, marketing, sales) to deliver impactful solutions
* Continuously gather insights from data, user research, and market trends to inform decisions
* Lead product discovery to deeply understand customer needs and ensure value-driven solutions
* Track and evaluate product performance using both qualitative and quantitative metrics
* Act as the voice of the customer and business within the team, ensuring alignment across stakeholders
* Drive prioritization and facilitate alignment to keep the team focused on high-impact work


- 


*We have a collaboration-first policy, which means our employees work three days from the office and two days from anywhere they choose.* 




  





**Are We a Match?** 




 To thrive at Svea Solar, it’s important that our values align with yours. To succeed in this role, you should be a strategic thinker with a bias for action, data-driven decision-making, and a strong sense of ownership.
 



  





**We believe you..** 



* Are fluent in English or Swedish
* Have 5+ years of experience in Product Management, ideally with customer-facing digital products
* Have an strong understanding of user journeys, funnel optimization, and conversion metrics; experience with A/B testing and experimentation frameworks
* Have an proven ability to identify, prioritize, and deliver product improvements that drive measurable business impact
* Have an entrepreneurial mindset with a balance of data-driven decision-making and speed of execution
* Have experience working closely with cross-functional teams to bring consumer or internal-facing digital products from concept to launch


- 


 If you’ve worked with energy systems, SaaS platforms, or marketplace models—great. If not, we’re excited to hear how your experience brings fresh perspective!
 



  





**What We Offer** 




**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels** 




 Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations and batteries – we aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. Together with IKEA and other partners, we offer a curated portfolio of smart solutions that enable our customers to produce, store, and consume energy in a cost-effective way. We are constantly working to develop new solutions that make a difference – both for our customers and the climate. Read more here.
 



**Diversity & Inclusion** 




 At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion because we believe different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you’ll have the chance to grow professionally as we evolve as a company – contributing to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you’ll play an important role in “The Power Shift” – toward a greener future, with a strong focus on teamwork, growth, and a positive work environment. 🌱🌞
 



  





**Application** 



* We will start reviewing applications right away, so don’t wait to apply!
* On this page, you can find more information about our recruitment process.
* For the final candidate, we will do a background check from the criminal record.
* We warmly welcome your application! ☀

title: Insight & Analytics Manager
description:
Svensk Fastighetsförmedling som en del av Korall Group har nu möjligheten att erbjuda dig en strategisk nyckelroll som Insight & Analytics Manager. Rollen är ett vikariat på 12 månader med möjlighet till viss förlängning. I rollen kommer du tillsammans med ditt team att driva affärsnytta genom data, insikter och analys. I rollen kommer du att ha många kontaktytor både intern och externt och som en naturlig del kommer du att få stort utlopp för ditt innovativa och framåtlutade förhållningssätt.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Som Insight & Analytics Manager jobbar du nära affären och ledningsgruppen och ansvarar för att:
   

  

* Leda och utveckla insikts- och analysfunktionen, inklusive budget och kompetensplanering
* Underhålla och vidareutveckla teamets verktyg, metoder och processer
* Driva ett Data-as-a-Service-tänk där organisationen får tillgång till rätt data på ett tillgängligt och användbart sätt
* Vara produktägare för vår BI-plattform (Power BI) och GA4, med ansvar för roadmap, backlogg och affärskrav
* Kommunicera komplexa insikter på ett pedagogiskt och inspirerande sätt till olika delar av organisationen
* Vidareutveckla mätningar inom kundnöjdhet, varumärkestracking och kundsegmentering
* Arbeta med digital analys från webb, appar, sociala medier, e-post och sms
* Delta i affärsutvecklingsprojekt och stötta andra bolag inom koncernen med insikter.


 Verktyg du kommer att arbeta med:
   

  

 Power BI, SPSS, GA4, Google Tag Manager, Hotjar, KVS (egenutvecklat CRM, Symplify, SurveyMonkey m.fl.
   

  

 I rollen ingår personalansvar för vår fantastiska BI-datascientist och som Insight & Analytics Manager blir du en del av vår Experience avdelning. Du rapporterar till Chief Experience Officer. Önskad start 1 november 2025.
   

  

****VEM VI SÖKER****
 Vi söker dig som brinner för att utveckla och bidra med insikt till organisationer. Du har en god pedagogisk förmåga och en vana av att presentera data för beslutsfattare, som en naturlig del i arbetet är du självgående med en förmåga att planera och driva ditt eget arbete mot uppsatta mål. Vi tror att du är en person som får energi av att inspirera andra kring hur man kan bli bättre med hjälp av paketerade analyser. Du har en god förmåga att kommunicera med stakeholders och intressenter samt att förklara och förenkla komplexa frågor. Som person är du strukturerad och analytisk och gillar att kombinera eget arbete och samarbete med andra.
   

  

****KRAVPROFIL****
* En akademisk utbildning inom statistik, dataanalys, matematik eller likvärdigt
* God erfarenhet av ledarskap inom analys, insikt och BI
* Gedigen erfarenhet av digital analys och verktyg som Power BI, GA4 och Tag Manager
* Förmåga att översätta affärsmål till mätbara KPI:er och vidareutveckla strukturer för uppföljning
* Erfarenhet av både kvalitativa och kvantitativa undersökningsmetoder och kunna göra statistiska analyser med hjälp av SPSS.


**Vi ser det som meriterande om du har**
* Branscherfarenhet från mäkleri eller liknande tjänsteförmedlande verksamheter
* Certifieringar inom dataanalys, BI eller datavisualisering
* Erfarenhet av CRM-analys och verktyg som Salesforce eller Symplify
* Kunskap om undersökningsverktyg som SurveyMonkey, Hotjar eller Contentsquare.


 Vi ser gärna att du också arbetet med strategisk förståelse för varumärkes- och kampanjutvärdering och dess påverkan på försäljning.
   

  

**KONTAKT**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att höra av dig till TA Manager Anna Liljegren Rassing Anna.LiljegrenRassing@Svenskfast.se. Notera att alla ansökningar sker via annonsen av GDPR-skäl.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan snarast då urvalet kommer att ske löpande.
   

  

**OM OSS**
 Svensk Fastighetsförmedling är en del av Korall Group. Genom att utgå ifrån kundens situation och drivkrafter när vi utvecklar vår affär och erbjudande, blir vi mer relevanta och vi säkrar den bästa bostadsaffären och en stärkt boenderesa. Svensk Fastighetsförmedling är Sveriges största rikstäckande och oberoende mäklarkedja. Vi är experter på den lokala bostadsmarknaden med verksamhet i både Sverige och Spanien och har fler än 1250 medarbetare. Korall Groups vision är att skapa ett ekosystem av tjänster för boendelivet där värden växer. Korall Group utvecklar och erbjuder nya attraktiva tjänster både innan, under och efter bytet av bostad. Idag ingår även portföljbolaget Ordna Bolån samt intressebolaget HouseID. Tillsammans förenklar, möjliggör och inspirerar vi människor i alla faser av boendelivet.

title: Senior Workstation Support Engineer (Consultant) - FULL REMOTE (EUROPE)
description:
emagine is looking for a
 **Senior Workstation Support Engineer (Consultant)** 
 to join our client in Sweden.
   

  

**Start:** 
 1st of August
   

  

**End:** 
 31st of October
   

  

**Location:** 
 Remote 100% (preferably from Sweden)
   

  

**About the assignment:**
 You will be covering a parental leave from
 **1st August to 31st October 2025** 
 . There is no preference for the location of this role although they will need to support European hours of business.
   

  

**Profile:**
 The ideal candidate should be experienced in user
 **onboarding/offboarding across platforms such as JIRA, Confluence, Slack, and Google Workspaces** 
 , with a strong troubleshooting background and a mindset for automation to enhance user experience.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities:**
* Manage user onboarding and offboarding processes for applications including JIRA, Confluence, Google Workspaces, and Slack.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to JIRA, Confluence, Slack, and other workstation applications.
* Provide support and maintenance for Google Workspaces.
* Support onboarding / offboarding of users in Google Workspaces.
* Manage and address an active queue of ticket requests through JIRA ServiceDesk.
* Collaborate with other IT team members to ensure smooth operation of all SaaS applications.
* Document and maintain accurate records of support activities and resolutions.
* Train and assist users in utilizing workstation applications effectively.
* Develop and implement automation solutions to streamline processes and improve user experience.


**Key Requirements:**
* Proven experience in workstation support, specifically with JIRA, Confluence, Slack, and Google Workspaces.
* Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Relevant certifications in workstation support or related fields are a plus.
* Skills in automation and experience with automation tools and scripts.


**Other Details:**
 This role offers a full remote working environment within the European time zone. Ideal candidates will hold a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or a related field and have a minimum of 5 years of experience in workstation support.
   

  

 Interested candidates should submit their CV, availability, price, and a short motivation.

title: Technical Lead - Catheter R&D
description:
**We are assisting SmartCella in finding a proactive and technically skilled Technical Lead to drive the development of an innovative catheter-based medical device!** 




  





**About the company** 




 SmartCella is a global biotech company pioneering the future of targeted therapies through delivery solutions and advanced therapy development. Founded in 2014, the company is built on globally renowned science and research from Karolinska Institutet in Sweden. The company currently has approximately 80–85 employees and will continue to grow coming years.
 



 SmartCella combines novel delivery platforms, such as the Extroducer®, an endovascular delivery device that enables direct injection to hard-to-reach organs and tissues, with state-of-the-art development and manufacturing of cell therapies. The company operates in two business segments: Targeted Delivery and Regenerative Medicines.
 



 As Technical Lead – Product Development, you will be part of the Targeted Delivery division. Please read more about that business segment
 **here**
 !
 



  





**About the position** 




 As Technical Lead – Product Development, you will play a key role in SmartCella’s exciting journey of growth and innovation. This role is critical in overseeing the full R&D cycle, from concept development through prototyping, verification, validation, and design transfer. The position requires a balance of hands-on engineering, project leadership, and cross-functional collaboration.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 




 · Lead technical development projects, including new product development and product upgrades.
 



 · Serve as the Design Responsible for assigned catheter-based products.
 



 · Define and refine design inputs and requirements in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
 



 · Manage design documentation, including design outputs, risk assessments, test plans, and technical reports.
 



 · Interface with clinicians and end-users to gather requirements and evaluate usability.
 



 · Plan, track, and communicate technical progress and milestones to stakeholders.
 



 · Drive continuous improvement of internal R&D and cross-functional processes.
 



  





**Who we are looking for** 




 You possess strong organizational and leadership skills, with the ability to manage long-term projects and coordinate cross-functional teams. Further, you have a results-oriented mindset, with a high degree of initiative and follow-through and you communicate and document effectively in both technical and cross-disciplinary contexts.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 




 · University degree in Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or a related discipline.
 



 · Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in medical device product development, preferably with catheter-based systems.
 



 · Proven experience in verification and validation of medical devices.
 



 · Solid understanding of regulatory and quality frameworks, including ISO 13485, FDA QSR, and EU MDR.
 



 · Proficiency in risk management methodologies, particularly in accordance with ISO 14971.
 



  





**Additional information** 




 This is a full-time position at SmartCella
 



 Office location: Tullinge, Stockholm
 



 In our recruitment processes we use continuous selection. This means that we review and process applications for the position and conduct interviews continuously. If you find an interesting position with us, we therefore recommend that you apply for the position as soon as possible. You apply for our positions by registering your CV and answering the selection questions for each position, with us you apply without a personal letter and instead you get the chance to motivate your interest in the position in the questions in the application form.
 



  





**Do you have any questions about the position?** 




 Please feel free to contact Anna Maria Lindqvist.
 



 Anna Maria Lindqvist: 070 589 23 19 / anna-maria.lindqvist@medhouse.se
 



  





**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Product Owner & Team Lead Embedded Systems (all genders)
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Product Owner & Team lead - Embedded Systems (all genders)
   

  

**Location:** 
 Munters, Kista
   

  

**Overview**
 At Munters, we are on a mission to shape a more sustainable world through innovative climate solutions. As we continue our digital transformation, we are looking for a
 **Product Owner & Team Lead for Embedded Systems (all genders)** 
 to join our team in Kista.
   

  

 This role position combines the responsibilities of a Product Owner—guiding embedded product development with a user-centric and platform-aligned approach—with team leadership responsibilities. You will lead a team of embedded system developers, and support the collaboration with other teams and stakeholders, and play a key role in team development, performance, and motivation.
   

  

 This position offers a unique chance for someone who enjoys integrating strategic product management with direct leadership of a technical team
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**As Product owner:**
* Own and prioritize the backlog


 You will work closely with the Product Managers and Technical Product Managers to translate the product vision and roadmap into user stories and tasks, prioritize and deliver high-quality features while maintaining alignment with customer needs and technical feasibility.
   

  

* Foster a collaborative team environment
* Work closely with hardware and software developers, scrum master, UX/UI designers, and other stakeholders to build a cohesive team that thrives on open communication, trust, mutual respect, and shared goals. You should be able to handle and resolve disagreements constructively, ensuring that all team members are included and valued
* Align with platform strategy
* Prioritize embedded systems and platform improvements that directly impact product features or control system capabilities. Collaborate with line manager and embedded software developers to ensure platform development supports product development.
* Product support & improvements
* Handle and prioritize support cases escalated from the global service team — focusing on critical product issues and product improvements. Ensure timely resolution and clear communication with relevant stakeholders throughout the process.
* Support production tools & testing


 Act as the main point of contact for the production team regarding the embedded control system, configuration tools, and end-of-line testing. Collect and assess their input and support needs, ensure clear communication on firmware releases, bug fixes, and tool updates, and prioritize their requirements in the product backlog. Collaborate closely with production to develop and improve tools and processes that support efficient and reliable manufacturing.
   

  

* Drive timely and qualitative delivery
* Collaborate with the Scrum Master role and the technical team to define user stories, ensure features are delivered on time, and meet expected quality standards.
* Validate features and user needs


 Use feedback loops, testing, and analytics to evaluate feature effectiveness and guide backlog updates
   

  

**As a Team Lead**
* Lead and support the team


 Serves as the
 **day-to-day go-to person** 
 for team members, providing coaching, support, helping resolve blockers, and regular development dialogues.
   

  

* Foster a supportive culture


 Promote a psychologically safe and collaborative environment where team members recognize being engaged, heard, and empowered
   

  

* Performance & competence development (in coordination with line manager)


 Gives regular feedback and guidance on performance and development needs.
   

  

* Resource planning and recruitment (in coordination with line manager)


 Supporting with identifying resource needs, supporting recruitment and onboarding.
   

  

* Act as a cultural role model


 Set a positive tone, promote cross-team alignment, and be a change agent during organizational transformation.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Experience as a Product Owner or similar role in embedded systems or control systems
* Prior leadership experience or clear potential to take on formal people leadership.
* Thorough understanding of agile methodologies, Scrum
* Comprehensive understanding of embedded systems and their integration into product development
* Familiarity with C/C++ and embedded development practices.
* Practical experience with Azure DevOps or Jira for backlog and sprint management
* Experience in embedded system development, including working with control systems and platform improvements.
* Analytical skills with a focus on technical product development and customer needs.
* Experience handling technical support cases and collaborating with technical teams to resolve issues efficiently.
* Skilled written and verbal communications skills in English
* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field


**Soft Skills**
* Effective communication skills with the ability to collaborate across hardware, software, and business teams
* Ability to actively listen to feedback from the team, customers, and stakeholders, and use this input to adjust the product direction when needed.
* Ability to collaborate in a diverse and cross-functional work environment to ensure alignment and that everyone is working toward the same objectives.
* Help create a productive environment that motivates team members to collaborate and share their knowledge
* Ability to make informed decisions on which features to prioritize based on business needs, user value, and technical resources is essential. This requires a balance between making quick decisions and remaining responsive to feedback and data.
* Lead the team through disagreements to align on ways of working within the team as well as with other stakeholders
* Be able to inspire the team by clearly conveying the product vision in a compelling way that encourages engagement and motivation
* Be able to make sound decisions even when not all facts are available, and act as a stable leader when the team is facing challenges.
* Skilled at balancing short-term delivery and long-term goals.

title: Senior Technical Producer
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is hiring a Senior Technical Producer to our central technology organization, Central Tech.
   

  

**The Position**
 Central Tech is our core technology team and we innovate in areas that push the boundaries for what open-world sandbox gaming means as well as improve, optimize, and support our existing core technology. In this role, you will help develop, champion, and communicate the product vision with the management and director groups to build and maintain a strong team spirit and a highly collaborative, productive environment.
   

  

 You will be primarily responsible for monitoring the progress of cross-disciplined teams and maintaining the schedule and backlog. Your work in coordinating resources and goals alongside the PO and discipline leads will ensure the successful completion of milestones and deliveries.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Take responsibility for the team’s deliverables.
* Act as a point of contact for the project, you’ll manage the collaboration with our intern central tech teams and external teams, coordinating our efforts to achieve short and long-term goals.
* Actively assess and manage risks, issues and dependencies that could impact team execution, mitigating or elevating them in a timely manner.
* Collaborate closely with the Technical Directors and PO’s to prioritize and plan the team’s work effectively.
* Take charge of building an effective team, ensuring the right competencies are in place to achieve the team's goals.
* Be responsible for building an effective team. This involves dealing with conflicts, providing feedback, and conducting 1:1’s.
* Champion company and Central Tech guidelines and processes within the team.


**Who You Are**
* A seasoned Technical Project Manager in the tech or gaming industry.
* Skilled in risk and operational management, with a keen eye for identifying potential issues and implementing effective solutions.
* Experience in leading and motivating agile development teams where coaching and mentoring towards success are part of your leadership style.
* Extensive knowledge in Agile/Scrum development methodology.
* Experience with working and coordinating with external departments.
* Experience managing remote and distributed teams.
* Excellent listening and communication skills with the ability to communicate goals, give and receive feedback and requests in a clear, concise manner to internal teams and external stakeholders.
* Collaborative spirit.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Android Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software team with a Android developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Maintain and develop Android mobile apps for the Marshall brands
* Collaborate closely with our UX and Design team to discuss new features and functions.
* Support and participate in testing activities and evaluation of the app.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Teamwork with the other developers to help us brainstorm solutions and make our apps even better for our users.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are an Android developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be committed to collaborative problem-solving, and build quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* + 3 years of proven professional Android app development experience.
* Experience working with Kotlin.
* Proficient in modern android design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection) and Jetpack components.
* Familiarity with coroutines and Compose, Dagger Hilt and Clean Architecture.
* Good understanding of Firebase & REST etc.
* Hence strong written and spoken English skills are essential.
* Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is a plus.


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!
