* Continuously learn about Scaleway’s offerings and cloud industry trends

* Engage with technical teams when needed to address prospect needs

* Maintain a hunting and growth-oriented mindset

 **ABOUT YOU**
### **HARDSKILLS :**

* 1+ year of experience in a Sales Development / Inside Sales / Business Development role
* Previous experience in IT, SaaS, or cloud environments (minimum 6 months to 1 year)
* Proficient with sales tools (Salesforce, Outreach, Lusha, etc.)
* Strong understanding of sales prospecting and outbound strategies
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Nice to Have : French

### **SOFTSKILLS :**

* Strong hunter mindset: goal-driven, persistent, proactive
* Comfortable with cold calling and initiating conversations
* Social and charismatic: able to build rapport easily
* Team-oriented and collaborative
* Curious and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment

 **Why join the Scaleway adventure?**
✔ A rich and diverse product offering: Scaleway offers over 100 public cloud products in IaaS, PaaS, and AI.  

✔ A cutting-edge technical environment: Scaleway provides modern infrastructures, including high-performance bare metal servers, to tackle exciting technical challenges.  

✔ Commitment to responsible cloud: Scaleway is dedicated to a more responsible cloud, with data centers powered solely by renewable energy since 2017, minimizing our ecological footprint and holding top-level certification. **THE NEXT STEPS …*** Initial conversation with the Talent Acquisition team (30 min)

* Interview with the Business Development Manager to discuss your approach and experience (45 min)

* Business case in English with our Team Lead + Account Executive for the Nordic Region (1h)

* Interview with future team members to assess fit and collaboration potential (45 min)

* Final interview with our CSO, Doreen Pernel (30 min)

 *At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.**All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.**We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.*
company_description: Scaleway is a Cloud Provider that supports the development, training, deployment, and scaling of infrastructure in a complete cloud ecosystem.

title: Cybersecurity Engineer
description:
Cybersecurity Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Location: Sodertalje, Sweden


Expected Start date: Aug/Sept 2025


Job Name: Senior Cybersecurity Engineer


* A strong background in automotive systems is essential, along with hands-on experience in the areas outlined below.
* The assignment will begin with a short on-site introduction period to support knowledge transfer.
* After that, the work can be carried out remotely. But you may need to be on site once each 10 week.


The team’s mission is to ensure cybersecurity compliance for an external software supplier and to adapt existing vehicle control software to a new hardware platform.

  


Required skills:


* More than 10 years experience.
* Experience with Scania CSS and related toolchains
* Knowledge of ISO/SAE 21434 and UNECE R155/156
* Familiarity with CAN communication protocols
* Ability to validate secure boot, authentication, and diagnostic services
* Strong documentation skills
* Strong communication skills in English (spoken and written)
* Ability to collaborate remotely with international suppliers
* Experience working in cross-functional teams

  
Job Overview


* Location : Södertälje, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : ISO 21434, R155/156, CAN, UDS

title: Data- och informationssamordnare inom väg och järnväg
description:
**Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Gävle, Helsingborg**
--------------------------------------------------


**Sista ansökningsdag:** 7 september, 2025


Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Vi är specialister inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur som bygger samhällen som håller.
**Om tjänsten**

Som *Data- och informationssamordnare inom väg och järnväg* hos oss på Tyréns kommer du arbeta inom vårt nationella affärsområde *BIM Strategi & Samordning* och kompetensområde *Informationssamordning*



I stora infrastrukturuppdrag arbetar du tätt med BIM-samordning, applikationsspecialister och uppdrags/projekteringsledning för att fastställa strategi och arbetssätt med avseende på projektering och modellsamordning.



I denna roll kommer du exempelvis jobba med att:


* Teknikansvarig Datasamordning
* Leda arbetet med i uppdragen
* Administration av Sharepoint, projketerings- och samordningsplattform
* Projektuppstart
* Hantering av inkommande underlag
* Behörighetshantering
* Delgivning och leverans mellan olika datamiljöer
* Leveranskontroll och kvalitetssäkring av dokument, ritningar och modeller
* Data- och informationssäkerhetsfrågor


**Vi erbjuder**
* Fantastiska kollegor och många specialister inom våra olika kompetensområden
* En värderingsdriven kultur där *Connect*, *Create* & *Challenge* är våra ledord
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö i våra lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån del av din arbetstid
* Arbete i projekt tillsammans med dina Tyréns-kollegor, vi jobbar ofta i teamleveranser (sällan som enstaka resurser på plats hos våra kunder)
* Möjlighet att jobba med innovationsprojekt
* Kompetensutveckling anpassad efter dig
* Sociala aktiviteter, både på och efter ordinarie arbetstid
* Fast månadslön
* Extra lediga dagar utöver dina semesterdagar, vi är t.ex. alltid lediga med lön dagarna mellan jul och nyår
* Flertalet personalförmåner via vår förmånsportal
* Kollektivavtal som vi tecknat med Innovationsföretagen (Almega)

  


**Vi söker**



För att lyckas och trivas i rollen anser vi att du bör ha:


* Minst sju års erfarenhet i rollen som datasamordnare inom infrastruktur projekt
* Vana av att arbeta i multidisciplinära uppdrag


Meriterande är erfarenhet/kunskap inom:
* BIM-samordning
* Datorvana
* Bentley ProjectWise
* Bentley Microstation
* Autodesk AutoCAD eller Civil3D
* Autodesk Navisworks
* Autodesk Vault professional
* Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC)
* Microsoft 365
* Microsoft Sharepoint
* Trafikverket Chaos


Personliga egenskaper vi tror passar rollen och vår företagskultur:
* Kommunikativ
* Strukturerad
* Våga fatta snabba beslut
* Lösningsorienterad


För denna tjänst ser vi att du hanterar det svenska och engelska språket i både tal och skrift för att kunna tillmötesgå våra kunder och kollegors behov.
**Ansöka**



Du är varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Personligt brev är inte ett krav hos oss, men kommer naturligtvis läsas om det bifogas.



Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag då tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.



Med hänvisning till GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar per mejl utan hanterar enbart ansökningar som kommer in via ansökningslänken.


*Med anledning av sommarsemester kan återkoppling på din ansökan komma att dröja till i slutet på augusti/början på september beroende på när du ansöker.*


**Kontakt**



Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller har frågor? Då är du välkommen att kontakta:


**Jakob Berggren**  

**Avdelningschef**  

Mejl: Jakob.Berggren@tyrens.se  

Telefon: 010-452 20 84


Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Tyrénskoncernen har 3 000 medarbetare med verksamhet i Sverige, Storbritannien, Estland, Litauen, Polen, Bulgarien och Kanada. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och innovation inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
**About Medius**


Medius is a Swedish origin company & a leading global provider of cloud-based SaaS spend management solutions, helping organizations drive their business forward by enabling best-in-class process efficiency, cost-savings, and greater financial control.


Spend management doesn’t ring a bell? This term describes the process from placing an order through its delivery, verification, invoicing to its payment. Our products help companies at every step of the purchasing process, increasing their security and speeding it up. We use the latest advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning to automatically capture and process invoices.


If you are seeking a stimulating environment characterized by unparalleled momentum and rapid growth, look no further. Join us as we lead the charge in reshaping the future of spend management, setting new standards of excellence, and driving impactful change across industries.


For more info: www.medius.com

**Our values**

* **Connect:** We believe in the power of people, both individually and collectively. Our success is driven by respect and understanding, with a shared commitment to empowering finance teams of the future.
* **Question:** We embrace challenges and value diverse perspectives. By questioning and collaborating, we unlock better solutions and continuously innovate.
* **Own:** We are proactive, decisive, and committed to delivering results. We anticipate customer needs and follow through, earning their trust to focus on what they do best.

**Job overview**


MediusGo is a smaller part of Medius and provides a cloud service for invoice management aimed at small and medium-sized businesses.  

The service is hosted in Azure and built using the latest technologies.  

You will be working in a small development team of about 10–12 people, where most of the languages and tools are Microsoft-based.

**Some of the tasks you will be performing**

* Database management in general – Writing/modifying stored procedures, creating/modifying tables
* Backend development in C#
* Frontend development in Vue.js
* Azure Functions – Creating/modifying

**Requirements for the position**

* GIT
* SQL Server (SQL as language)
* C#
* Vue.js (or knowledge in another frontend framework)

**What we offer**

* An optimized on-boarding in order to facilitate the integration and the discovery of the teams.
* A strong and positive company culture, with close-knit teams and a stimulating work environment.
* A great flexibility in the organization of work (work from home possible).
* All company seminars and celebration trips and other spontaneous events.
* Multiple benefits such as a great health insurance, continuous training…

**Please send your resume in English (Any resumes** submitted in another language will be automatically rejected).

title: Engineering Operations Technician , Data Center
description:
• High school or equivalent diploma 
• 1 to 4 years of Knowledge of key electrical competencies and theory; generic mechanical room infrastructure such as chillers, cooler units, and fan controls; backup generator systems
• Valid EU driving license;
  

We are looking for a Data Center Engineering Operations Technician to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. Data Center Engineering Operations Technician is a hands-on electrical and mechanical equipment troubleshooting and operation responder. If you like to use apply your electrical and mechanical skills to solve problems, we’d like to meet you. Your work will help to maintain one of the world's largest information system infrastructures.
We are currently hiring Data Center Engineering Operations Technicians in our mission-critical data centers in Sweden: Katrineholm.
\* A valid driver's license is required for this role.
AWS Infrastructure Services (AIS)
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
Key job responsibilities
SAFETY
Follow and maintain the highest safety standards and diligently encourage a world-class safety culture. As a facility owner team, ensure remediation of safety risks/issues in conjunction with other teams. Own the safety initiatives and projects to foster strong safety culture.
ENGINEERING & FACILITY OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE
Operational experience and familiarity with electrical and mechanical equipment, including Uninterruptable Power Supplies (UPS’s), Switchgear, Circuit Breakers, Automatic Transfer Switches (ATS's), Diesel Generators, Chillers, Heating Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC), Exhaust Fans, Variable Frequency Drives (VFD's), and Transformers.
oTroubleshoot events within internal Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
o Take daily operational readings of all mechanical and electrical equipment through routine rounds/log-taking (temperatures, voltages, currents, etc.)
o Supervise contractors who perform servicing or preventive maintenance
Physical requirements
• Manual handling and lifting of equipment may be required (weight limits in accordance with regulations).
• Ability to work shifts (morning, late and night) 
• On-call rotation reaction to off-duty emergency calls (if applicable)
• Work at heights and from ladders; in a noisy environment with ear protection
• Perform physical tasks during the shift
A day in the life
Your day-to-day activities will include:
- Monitoring alarms and systems that manage power, cooling, and fire suppression in the data center.
- Coordinating vendor work on-site to ensure equipment is maintained and uptime is preserved.
- Supporting other teams and sites during events and planned works.
- Handling rack installations and powering up equipment.
- Monitoring and facilitating the handover of new equipment.
- Sharing knowledge and supporting new team members.
- Participating in event response drills.
About the team
Diverse Experiences 
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS 
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Work/Life Balance 
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
Inclusive Team Culture 
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  

* Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or relevant discipline + Professional Certification in Electrical, Mechanical or Controls engineering.
* Experience in operations of critical facilities (Heavy Industry or Data Centers) which require in-depth knowledge in electrical, mechanical, and control systems and Data Center engineering experience

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
*\*Applications open now - Interviews starting in August when we return from summer break\** 




  





**Is this you?** 
  
 


* You're currently working in Customer Success (or sales) at a SaaS company
* You have 1-3 years of experience and are ready for the next step in your career
* You're based in Stockholm or nearby and enjoy working from the office most days
* You're excited about joining a growing startup and want more ownership, impact, and the chance to shape how customer success is done



  
 



***If this sounds like you, keep reading - we might be your next career move.***





  
 



**About DigiProc** 
  
 



 DigiProc is an innovative SaaS company helping businesses gain control over their supplier relationships through our powerful platform. We enable companies to negotiate better prices, reduce risk, and manage their entire supplier ecosystem from a single solution. As a fast-growing startup in the heart of Stockholm, we're looking for passionate individuals who thrive in a dynamic environment and want to make a real impact. 
 



  





**The Role** 
  
 



 We're seeking a Customer Success Manager who is ready to take the next step in their career. You'll be instrumental in ensuring our customers achieve maximum value from DigiProc, working directly with clients to drive adoption and build lasting relationships that lead to renewals and growth. 
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 
  
 


* Onboard new customers and guide them through the implementation process
* Help clients execute successful supplier negotiations to achieve price savings, improved payment terms, implementation of Code of Conduct policies etc.
* Drive platform adoption and ensure customers realize tangible value from DigiProc
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders at client organizations
* Work closely with our Sales team on renewal strategies and identifying expansion opportunities
* Monitor customer health metrics and proactively address potential issues
* Gather customer feedback to help improve our platform and services
* Serve as the voice of the customer within DigiProc



  
 



**Requirements** 
  
 


* 1-3 years of Customer Success Manager or Sales experience at a SaaS company (this is essential)
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Experience working with CRM systems - HubSpot experience strongly preferred
* Experience with B2B customers
* Proven ability to manage customer relationships and drive satisfaction
* Strong communication and relationship-building skills
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment
* Interest in procurement, supplier management, or negotiations is a plus



  
 



**Why Join DigiProc?** 
  
 


* **Career Growth** 
 : Opportunity to build and shape the customer success function as we scale
* **Learning Environment** 
 : Work directly with founders and senior leadership
* **Real Impact** 
 : Your work directly influences customer success and company growth
* **Startup Culture** 
 : Close-knit team of 14 where everyone's voice matters
* **Innovation** 
 : Encouraged to experiment, learn fast, and drive improvements
* **Work-Life Balance** 
 : Centrally located Stockholm office where we work together most days with flexible arrangements



  
 



**Location** 
 Kammakargatan 48, Stockholm 
 



**Employment Type** 
 Full-time

title: Inside Sales Representative - Nordics
company_industry: Retail Apparel and Fashion, Financial Services, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**OUR STORY:**
 🇪🇺 Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !
   

  

 Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.
   

  

 Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.
   

  

 With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing €3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.
   

  

 Every day, thanks to our rich catalog of products and services (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves 38,000 private and public sector clients, from Photoroom to Mistral AI, Golem AI, and ADEME.
   

  

 📍 Our offices are located in
 **Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Bordeaux, Rouen, Rennes and Lyon.**
**WHY WE NEED YOU?**
 Our growth is driving us to strengthen our Sales team to support our strategic expansion in the Nordic region.
   

  

 Your mission will be to identify and engage with key accounts in Sweden and across the Nordics in order to generate qualified opportunities for our Account Executives and contribute to our international business growth.
   

  

**YOUR FUTURE TEAM**
 We work in a collaborative and international environment where the diversity of Scalers, combined with a spirit of sharing, helps bring new projects to life every day, advancing our ambitions together.
   

  

 You will be part of a team of 11 people, working closely with Account Executives as a duo to develop a strong pipeline in your territory.
   

  

 The team is led by Pilar Balhadere and organized around a Manager, a Team Lead, and Inside Sales Representatives. Each ISR is assigned 200 strategic target accounts and works with sales architects and AEs to engage them through multi-channel outreach.
   

  

**YOUR DAILY ROUTINE**
* Conduct outbound prospecting via cold calls, cold emails, and social selling
* Manage email campaigns to generate qualified leads
* Map accounts and identify key stakeholders
* Collaborate closely with Account Executives on territory planning and deal strategy
* Use tools such as Outreach, Salesforce, Lusha, Humanlinker, and Confluence to manage your activity
* Track progress and report performance on your accounts
* Participate in team-based prospecting initiatives and events
* Continuously learn about Scaleway’s offerings and cloud industry trends
* Engage with technical teams when needed to address prospect needs
* Maintain a hunting and growth-oriented mindset


**About You**
**HARDSKILLS :**
* 1+ year of experience in a Sales Development / Inside Sales / Business Development role
* Previous experience in IT, SaaS, or cloud environments (minimum 6 months to 1 year)
* Proficient with sales tools (Salesforce, Outreach, Lusha, etc.)
* Strong understanding of sales prospecting and outbound strategies
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Nice to Have : French


**SOFTSKILLS :**
* Strong hunter mindset: goal-driven, persistent, proactive
* Comfortable with cold calling and initiating conversations
* Social and charismatic: able to build rapport easily
* Team-oriented and collaborative
* Curious and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment


**🚀Why join the Scaleway adventure?**
 ✔ A rich and diverse product offering: Scaleway offers over 100 public cloud products in IaaS, PaaS, and AI.
   

  

 ✔ A cutting-edge technical environment: Scaleway provides modern infrastructures, including high-performance bare metal servers, to tackle exciting technical challenges.
   

  

 ✔ Commitment to responsible cloud: Scaleway is dedicated to a more responsible cloud, with data centers powered solely by renewable energy since 2017, minimizing our ecological footprint and holding top-level certification.
   

  

**🔜 THE NEXT STEPS …**
* Initial conversation with the Talent Acquisition team (30 min)
* Interview with the Business Development Manager to discuss your approach and experience (45 min)
* Business case in English with our Team Lead + Account Executive for the Nordic Region (1h)
* Interview with future team members to assess fit and collaboration potential (45 min)
* Final interview with our CSO, Doreen Pernel (30 min)


*At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.*
*All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.*
*We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.*

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**About Eghed** 




 Eghed is an expertise company passionate about creating the AI solutions of the future. We are an innovative team with a strong passion for technology and an entrepreneurial spirit that permeates everything we do. Through close collaborations with our partners, both on-site and in-house, we develop solutions that not only meet today’s needs but also open doors to tomorrow’s possibilities. We have already developed proprietary IP that accelerates our deliveries, and we are constantly seeking new ways to push the boundaries of what is possible.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who shares our passion for creating something new and has the courage to explore uncharted territories. Here at Eghed, you’ll have the opportunity to help build the company from the ground up, shape our technical solutions, and be a key player in our continued growth. We love individuals who are accustomed to solving complex problems and who thrive in a dynamic environment where no two days are the same.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities May Include** 



* Leverages data to solve complex problems, extract meaningful insights, and inform decision-making processes within an organization.
* Work at the intersection of statistics, programming, and business, using tools like machine learning, data mining, and predictive modeling to analyze large datasets.
* Gather, clean, and process data, developing and training algorithms, and present findings in a way that is understandable and actionable for stakeholders.
* Helps both us and our partners to optimize processes, identify trends, and develop data-driven strategies for growth and innovation.



  





**We Believe That You** 



* Have at least 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist, preferably with a consulting background.
* A university degree in a highly technical and quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Software Development, Engineering, or Economics).
* Proven experience in developing classification models using machine learning techniques.
* Proficiency with Python, SQL, and Git, along with a solid understanding of cloud computing concepts.
* Strong understanding of the theoretical foundations behind both classical and modern machine learning models and algorithms, such as generalized linear models, random forests, ensemble methods, and deep neural networks.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, both technical and non-technical. Strong skills in communication, organization, and teamwork, combined with solid business acumen.
* Thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you have the freedom to think and create on a large scale.
* Are committed to contributing to the company’s success and growth and have an entrepreneurial spark.



  





**Why Eghed?** 




 At Eghed, you won’t just get a job – you’ll get an opportunity to join a journey where you can make an impact and create real change. We are a team that values innovation, collaboration, and a healthy dose of fresh thinking. Here, you’ll have the space to grow both professionally and personally, and we look forward to hearing your ideas and visions for the future.

title: Enterprise Account Executive
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Technology, Information and Media, and Software Development
description:
**Enterprise Account Executive – Sweden** 




**Stockholm – Hybrid** 




**Salary:** 
 1.6m - 2m SEK (OTE on 50/50 split)
 



  





 I'm currently working with a scaling SaaS company that’s redefining how procurement teams operate.
 



  





 They’ve developed a powerful supplier intelligence platform that helps enterprise customers gain full visibility and control over their spend. They’re now hiring an
 **Enterprise Account Executive** 
 to join their Stockholm office and lead new business efforts across the Nordics.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 This is a high-impact, end-to-end sales role focused on driving growth across mid-market and enterprise segments in Sweden. The company is looking for someone who thrives in a consultative sales environment, understands the procurement space (or is eager to learn), and has a proven track record of exceeding targets in a SaaS environment.
 



  





**What You'll Be Doing** 



* Leading the full sales cycle from prospecting to closing enterprise-level deals
* Generating and managing a pipeline through outbound efforts, networking, and inbound qualification
* Running tailored product demos that map to customer pain points and priorities
* Navigating complex sales processes and multistakeholder environments
* Negotiating commercial terms and closing deals aligned with customer needs and business goals
* Staying plugged into the procurement and SaaS ecosystem in Sweden to identify new opportunities



  





**What They're Looking For** 



* 4–10 years of success in B2B SaaS sales, with experience closing deals in the mid-market or enterprise space
* Strong consultative sales approach
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English
* Experience managing longer sales cycles and engaging with senior decision-makers
* Familiarity with tools like HubSpot or similar CRMs
* A proactive, self-starting mindset with the ability to work independently and drive outcomes



**Bonus Points:** 



* Experience in procurement tech or consulting is highly desirable



  





**Why This Role?** 



* You’ll be selling a best-in-class product that’s already delivering measurable impact to procurement teams.
* Flat structure and fast decision-making — your voice will be heard, and your work will matter.
* Equity opportunity available, along with a competitive base + commission structure
* You'll be surrounded by a smart, motivated, and down-to-earth team.
* Great central office in Stockholm with regular team events and offsites



  





 If you're a driven SaaS sales professional looking to step into a strategic role with lots of autonomy, and you're excited by the idea of helping procurement teams do their best work, this is worth a conversation.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Period from:** 
 2025-06-30
   

  

**Period to:** 
 2026-02-28
   

  

**Location:** 
 On-site in Stockholm
   

  

**Job description:**
 The primary tasks for a senior level Machine Learning Engineer are:
   

  

* Develop AI/ML software products and solutions, including but not limited to explore large data set, feature engineering, data pipelines, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out for a maintainable solution in the comprehensive fashion network of the client.
* Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.
* Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns contributing to architectural decisions, technical roadmap planning, technical documentation, and to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.
* Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address both specific and common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, monitoring, A/B test, versioning, release, and serving of both online inference endpoints and batch inference.
* Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders - to build the AI ecosystem within the company.


 Required skills and experiences:
   

  

* Have a BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Have 5+ years’ professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a senior level Machine Learning Engineer, ideally with experience in supply chain and demand forecasting solutions.
* A hands-on person, with great software engineering skills, who loves coding, and knows how to apply good software engineering practices, DevOps, testing and SRE principals - also for machine learning and AI projects.
* Have extensive experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production and scaled in a bigger organization, also ensuring and fulfilling product quality, cybersecurity and performance requirements.
* Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 4+ years, incl. developing back-end services.
* Have great hands-on experience with cloud technologies for cloud solutions and ML development, ideally Google Cloud Platform, and also including Vertex AI.
* Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, data pipelines and deploying ML applications to production.
* Have a foundational data science background and a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
* Have experience handling and developing for high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream), preferably also including hands-on development in SQL and DBT, and have a solid understanding of cloud data storage technologies and data quality.
* Have experience from aligning and analyzing business needs and requirement; driving design solutions; breaking down work into stories and tasks; communicating with stakeholders and supporting team members; and making sure organizational standards and best-practices are implemented and followed.
* Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration and data-driven

title: Senior DevSecOps Engineer
description:
**About The Position**
 At Kreditz, we believe financial data should empower people and businesses — not limit them. Our platform turns raw financial information into actionable insights for credit, risk, and identity. As we scale across Europe, we’re looking for a Senior DevSecOps Engineer who’s excited about building secure, reliable systems and wants to play a key role in how we grow securely.
   

  

 You’ll join a product-driven team where security is seen as an enabler of innovation — not a blocker. If you care about impact, autonomy, and working with kind and driven people, you’ll fit right in.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 As a DevSecOps Engineer you will:
   

  

* Champion security across our AWS infrastructure, implement resilient architecture and systems that scale safely.
* Build and continuously improve our CI/CD pipelines in GitHub Actions — ensuring they’re not only fast and efficient, but robust and secure from end to end.
* Design guardrails and tools that help developers write secure code, from IDE to production.
* Integrate and manage SCA, SAST, and DAST tooling across the software development lifecycle, working closely with engineering teams.
* Implement smart, scalable security monitoring and alerting that helps us catch issues early and learn fast.
* Collaborate across teams to guide decisions on secure design, coding practices, and threat modeling.
* Contribute to shaping a security-first culture that supports both compliance and innovation.


**Candidate Requirements**
* Experience: +3 years documented experience from working in security-focused infrastructure, platform engineering or DevSecOps roles and you are comfortable navigating both code and cloud.
* AWS expertise: You understand AWS deeply, particularly in areas like IAM, networking, encryption, and monitoring.
* CI/CD skills: You’ve built and secured pipelines, ideally with GitHub Actions.
* Coding experience and skills: You’ve worked as a developer preferably fullstack and have active skills in coding.
* Hands-on with tooling: You’ve worked with SCA/SAST/DAST tools and can evaluate, configure, and tune them across environments.
* Security Certifications: Certifications like OSCP, GPEN, or CEH are valuable to us because they demonstrate practical security acumen.


**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
* Pragmatism: You know how to strike a balance between security and speed — and when to advocate for one or the other.
* Team orientation: You enjoy collaborating with engineers, product managers, and compliance leads alike — bringing security into the conversation early.
* Growth mindset: You believe good security is always evolving and are excited to keep learning.


**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**
 As soon as possible
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Full-time, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Fixed monthly salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will report to the company's CISO
   

  

**WORKPLACE**
 Our office is in Danderyd, Stockholm, where we work together five days a week
   

  

**CRIMINAL RECORDS EXTRACT**
 As part of our recruitment process we will ask you to present a clean criminal records extract
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection)
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, COO, lorenzo@kreditz.com

title: Drift-tekniker
description:
**Vi söker en drift-tekniker med fokus på drift, underhåll samt vidareutveckling av vår IT-infrastruktur och private Cloud.** 




  





 Som drift-tekniker hos ISEC kommer fokus att ligga på att drifta och underhålla den IT-infrastruktur som ligger till grund för alla tekniska lösningar och den private Cloud-lösning som vi producerar för att erbjuda tjänster både internt och externt.
 



  





 Du kommer att jobba i ett tight team som bygger, driftar och underhåller en egen IT-plattform. Du blir en viktig medlem av teamet som nu behöver förstärkning av en nyfiken och driven kollega som är villig att lära sig nya saker samt ta ansvar.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har arbetat ett par år med IT-drift och IT-infrastruktur och som nu är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och att ta ett större ansvar hos oss och vår IT-infrastruktur. Rollen innebär frihet under ansvar och för rätt person så kan detta vara en bra möjlighet att lära sig mycket samtidigt som vi tillsammans kommer att vidareutveckla och förbättra plattformen för att säkerställa en stabil och säker leverans till våra användare.
 



  





 Plattformen bygger till stor del på Microsoft-produkter och VMware och vi ser gärna att du har minst 3 års erfarenhet av:
 



  




* Active Directory



 Konto-hantering, grupp-hantering samt behörigheter
 



 Group Policy Objects
 


* Microsoft Windows Server
* Microsoft SQL Server
* VMware ESXi
* VMware vCenter
* VMware vSAN
* Veeam Backup & Replication



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. Som person är du serviceinriktad, strukturerad och har god samarbetsförmåga.
 



  





 För att passa i rollen är det viktigt att du är lösningsorienterad, initiativrik och drivande i ditt arbete. Du har även goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift då du kommer att ha mycket kontakt med användare och kunder via vårt ärendehanteringssystem.
 



  





**Varför ISEC?** 




 Du erbjuds arbete i ett företag med spännande framtidsutsikter. Du får möjlighet att i ett nära samarbete med kollegor och kunder bygga vidare på din kompetens. Du får även möjlighet att påverka din roll inom företaget. Arbetsmiljön präglas av engagemang och delaktighet. Vill du arbeta med kreativa lösningar i ett framgångsrikt, växande och hållbart företag? Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan.
 



  





**Om oss!** 




 ISEC är den oberoende och strategiska partnern för organisationer och institutioner. Genom våra finansiella lösningar automatiserar och kvalitetssäkrar vi hela kapitalförvaltningsprocessen med syftet att skapa en hållbar fond- och kapitalmarknad.
 



  





 ISEC:s mjukvarubolag äger och utvecklar plattformen SECURA, marknadsledande för portfölj- och fondförvaltning. Tjänstebolaget, som står under Finansinspektionens tillsyn, bedriver fondhotellverksamhet och outsourcingtjänster inom fondadministration, Private Banking, riskhantering och fondbokföring. Kunderna består av banker, fondbolag, värdepappersbolag och kapitalförvaltare i Norden och Luxemburg.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Data engineer
description:
Data Engineer - Vi växer och söker en till kollega!
   

  

 Vi på Keolis förflyttar människor från A till B – och gör det smartare varje dag med hjälp av avancerade tekniska lösningar inom kollektivtrafiken. Nu stärker vi upp vårt team för Avancerad analys och söker ytterligare en Data Engineer! Vi har redan en ny kollega på väg in – nu letar vi efter dig som vill vara med på samma resa.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som
 **Data Engineer på Keolis** 
 är du med och säkerställer ett smidigt informationsflöde från våra bussar, depåer och stödsystem – samtidigt som du deltar i utvecklingen av nya, innovativa lösningar. Du blir en del av vårt växande team inom Avancerad analys som tillhör HQ Kungsholmen, där vi arbetar nära verksamheten för att skapa verklig nytta genom data. Hos oss får du arbeta självständigt men i samspel med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor. Du bygger och underhåller datalösningar, hanterar stora datamängder och utvecklar pipelines i en modern, molnbaserad miljö.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden
   

  

  

* Utveckla och optimera notebooks och pipelines för datatransformering
* Säkerställa datakvalitet och effektiv resursanvändning i vår dataplattform
* Arbeta med verktyg som Databricks, Azure och andra molnbaserade miljöer
* Bidra till vidareutveckling av vår dataarkitektur och våra processer
* Delta i och driva projekt inom avancerad analys


**Vem är du?**
 Du är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och trivs med att kombinera tekniskt djup med praktisk påverkan. Du har ett analytiskt sinne och är van att förklara tekniska lösningar på ett pedagogiskt sätt – oavsett målgrupp. Du gillar att arbeta självständigt men ser även värdet i samarbete.
   

  

 Du behöver även ha:
   

  

  

* Erfarenhet av Python, SQL, PySpark och underhåll av pipelines
* Kunskap om lakehouse-arkitektur, inkl. brons-, silver- och guldmodeller
* Ett starkt intresse för dataanalys och för att bygga framtidens lösningar .


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

  

* Hantering av stora datamängder och prestandaoptimering
* Azure, Databricks, Git/GitHub
* Tvärfunktionellt arbete i agila team
* Visualiseringsverktyg som Power BI


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
* Ett erfaret och dynamiskt team där du får stort utrymme att påverka.
* Utvecklingsmöjligheter och karriärtillväxt – Vi investerar i vår personal och skapar förutsättningar för kompetensutveckling och karriärvägar inom företaget.
* En inkluderande arbetsplats – Keolis var finalist i Inclusion Awards, en utmärkelse som hyllar aktörer som driver mångfald, jämlikhet och inkludering.
* Internationella perspektiv – som del av ett globalt bolag finns det möjlighet till internationell samverkan.
* Flexibilitet och förtroende – du har stort ansvar att planera ditt eget arbete.


**Nu tar vi nästa steg – och du kan vara en viktig del av det!**
 Vi har redan rekryterat en ny kollega till teamet och ser fram emot att välkomna ytterligare en Data Engineer som vill bidra till en mer datadriven kollektivtrafik.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du ansöker genom att skicka in ditt CV. Personligt brev behövs inte. I urvalsprocessen använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester från Alva Labs. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden gått ut.
   

  

**Observera att tjänsten kan komma att omfattas av en bakgrundskontroll** 
 . Denna genomförs i så fall först i slutskedet av rekryteringsprocessen efter ditt godkännande.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta Petra Gyllenberg som ansvarar för denna rekrytering, petra.gyllenberg@keolis.se
   

  

 Fackliga representanter:
   

  

 Facklig representant för Unionen är Nader Akbari, Unionen, 070-508 05 88, nader.akbari@keolis.se
   

  

 Facklig representant för Akademikerföreningen är Åsa Segersäll, asa.segersall@keolis.se

title: System Architect
description:
**About the job** 




 We develop and manufacture turnkey energy storage solutions, based on lithium-ion battery technology. Our goal is to engineer technology that both stores and optimizes energy as we shift towards more efficient energy usage and renewable energy sources on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with exceptional engineers, scientists, developers and more to pave the way for the next big leap in the energy industry through our battery energy storage and optimization systems.
 



  





***Location: Stockholm***




  





***Responsibilities:***



* Contribute as a system architect in all phases of development.
* Leverage your broad and deep knowledge of both hardware and software to ensure seamless system integration.
* Define requirements to ensure hardware, firmware and cloud solutions are seamlessly integrated into a well-functioning architecture.
* Drive the system architecture.
* Create system descriptions, test requirements and manage certification strategies.
* Create, align, and maintain the different system architectures within Polarium, including hardware, software and cloud infrastructure.
* Drive and participate in forums that influence decisions.
* Drive qualification studies in Technical roadmap.



  





***Qualifications and experience:***



* A minimum of 5 years of documented experience in complex system design, including both hardware and software.
* Proficiency in system architecture, firmware, and cloud solutions.
* Experience in cyber security and its regulatory requirements.
* Confidence in shifting from detailed analysis to a holistic perspective and clearly communicating concepts to engage the team.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to manage external contacts effectively.
* A proactive, innovative problem-solving mindset and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Fluency in English (both oral and written).
* Occasional travel is a part of this role



  





**We offer** 



* Bonus system
* Wellness contribution
* Pension



  





 Kindly submit your application through the provided apply button in the advertisement on our careers page, as we are unable to accept any applications via email in compliance with the GDPR regulations.
 



  





 At Polarium, creating change in the energy industry starts with our team. We believe a diverse workplace brings creativity, innovation and better represents our customers, and the many communities they serve, around the world. A positive work-life balance is what supercharges our teamwork and a sustainable personal journey throughout our careers.
 



  





 Since Polarium launched in 2015, we’ve been on a mission to redesign the energy industry. We’re unlocking the massive potential of energy storage systems through our wide range of intelligent and digital services. Our passion for solving challenges is what drives our next generation of premium energy storage products in use on all continents and in all climate zones. Today, we power businesses, optimize energy usage, and reduce carbon dioxide emissions to create a cleaner future in energy.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!
 



  





**About the company** 




 Building a Sustainable Future Together
 



  





 We are a Swedish company dedicated to providing the best-performing, safe, and sustainable energy storage solutions built on lithium-ion technology. Today, our market-leading solutions are in use on all continents and in all climate zones. We ensure that the flow of energy never stops, while enabling our customers to reduce their energy costs and carbon footprint.
 



  





 Do you share our vision for a smart and sustainable future? Join our team!

title: Seasoned Information Security Manager
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
Are you passionate about Information Security and eager to work with the business as security expert supporting our economic crime prevention, cyber security and product portfolios?
   

  

 Do you want to be a part of an international team of Information Security Manager professionals, who are jointly delivering challenging projects, maximizing customer value, and increasing Swedbank’s competitive advantage.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Work as part of a team of Information Security Manager professionals.
* Work as trusted advisors supporting business initiatives in matters related to information security.
* Identify, initiate, and lead initiatives to improve information security.
* Lead and perform information security risk identifications and risk assessments.
* Help with classification and identifying/gathering of security requirements.
* Coordinate with control functions and auditors and oversee completion of mitigations.

 What is needed in this role:

* Comprehensive understanding of the threat environment, relevant legal and regulatory requirements.

title: Senior Cloudification Software Expert
description:

* As the chief architect, design high performance, scalable Cloudification Software Architecture, contribute to improve the quality and capacity of network.

 yangkun61@huawei.com .

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Översikt över uppdraget:**
 Vi söker en senior dataingenjör som ska bli en del av ett kraftfullt data- och analysteam inom en global företagsorganisation. Du kommer att ta ett helhetsansvar för att utveckla och stödja molnbaserade dataprodukter i linje med modern data mesh-arkitektur och DevOps-metoder.
   

  

 Uppdraget inkluderar att bygga skalbara pipelines och infrastruktur på Google Cloud Platform (GCP) med hjälp av verktyg som Dataflow, BigQuery och DBT, samtidigt som höga standarder för observerbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda säkerställs.
   

  

**Nyckelansvar:**
 Bygga, optimera och supportera nya och befintliga dataprodukter
   

  

 Hantera CI/CD-pipelines och Terraform-infrastruktur i GCP
   

  

 Säkerställa att icke-funktionella krav (säkerhet, skalbarhet, observerbarhet) uppfylls
   

  

 Samarbeta med produktägare och tvärfunktionella team kring datavision
   

  

 Stödja data mesh-principer och kontinuerliga förbättringsinsatser
   

  

 Bidra till att minska teknisk skuld och driva moln-/datamognad
   

  

**Nödvändiga färdigheter och erfarenhet:**
 4+ års praktisk erfarenhet som dataingenjör på GCP
   

  

 Stark erfarenhet av Dataflow, BigQuery och DBT
   

  

 Skicklig inom SQL och datacentrerad programmering (Python, Java eller Scala)
   

  

 Bekant med dataformat som Avro och Parquet
   

  

 Erfarenhet av CI/CD, Terraform och DevOps i ett molnkontext
   

  

 God förståelse för datamodelleringstekniker
   

  

 Kunskap om NoSQL- och RDBMS-databaser
   

  

 Samarbetsvilligt tänkesätt och utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor
   

  

 Flytande engelska (skriftlig och muntlig)
   

  

**Bra att ha:**
 Erfarenhet av datavisualiseringsverktyg
   

  

 Förståelse för användningsområden inom detaljhandeln
   

  

 Bekant med data mesh-arkitektur och Datasamarbete mellan team
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper:**
 Passion för data, teknik och teamsamarbete
   

  

 Självdriven och bekväm med att fatta tekniska beslut
   

  

 Nyfiken, proaktiv och kvalitetsfokuserad
   

  

 Strukturerad och leveransorienterad

title: Workspace Support Engineer
description:
**About Us:**  

At TechStack Global AB, we’re a tight-knit team of software engineers driven by a shared passion for technology. Our mission is to empower clients by helping them realize their digital ambitions. Unlike traditional consultancies, we focus on hiring exceptional tech talent and aligning them with projects that challenge and inspire them, ensuring their skills are fully utilized.
  
  

**About the role:**  

**We're Hiring:** Senior Workstation Support Engineer (Remote – Europe/Sweden)
  
  

We're looking for an experienced Workstation Support Engineer to join one of our clients on a high-impact assignment starting this August. You'll play a key role in streamlining onboarding/offboarding processes and supporting core workplace tools like Google Workspace, JIRA, Confluence, and Slack.
  
  

**Role:** Senior Workstation Support Engineer (Consultant)
  
**Location:** Remote (within Europe or Sweden)
  
**️ Start Date:** 1st August 2025
  
**Apply By:** 9th July – Interviews start 11th July
  
  

**What You'll Do:**  

Handle onboarding/offboarding of users in JIRA, Confluence, Slack & Google Workspace
  
Support and troubleshoot user issues via JIRA ServiceDesk
  
Automate routine processes to boost efficiency
  
Collaborate with IT & cross-functional teams to ensure smooth tool usage
  
Document support workflows and train end-users
  
  

**✅ What You Bring:**  

5+ years of experience in IT/workstation support roles
  
Hands-on with Google Workspace, JIRA, Confluence, and Slack
  
Strong troubleshooting skills + a mindset for automation
  
Great communication skills & ability to work independently
  
Experience supporting distributed teams

title: I&C Principal Engineer
description:
At Westinghouse Electric Company, we are pioneers in nuclear technology and our technology is the basis for nearly half of the world's commercial nuclear power plants in operation. Today, we are also building several new reactors that contribute to more fossil-free energy. Globally, we have over 10,000 employees in 19 countries, of which 1,000 are at our Swedish workplaces in Västerås and Täby. Our Swedish operations were founded in 1969 and supply nuclear fuel as well as products and services in automation, maintenance, testing and decommissioning for customers around the world. Read more about us*www.westinghousenuclear.com**.*

**About the role:**
-------------------



As an **I&C Principal Engineer** you will develop, maintain, and improve applications built upon the Windows platform to support innovative solutions created for the commercial nuclear sector of the energy market. You have a sound working knowledge of programming languages while employing solid design principles.



You will report to the Nordic CIS Engineering Manager and be located in Västerås, Sweden. **Model of work: hybrid.**


**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------


* Design, implement and support nuclear applications based on our requirements and customer specifications using approved technologies and coding standards.
* Design, implement and support software components and systems to follow and satisfy engineering, scientific, regulatory, and manufacturing requirements.
* Be an expert in design development, coding, testing, and debugging new and legacy applications.
* Apply secure coding practices to prevent security vulnerabilities in code and apply object-oriented principles when implementing solutions.
* Maintain code quality through unit testing and documentation.
* Communicate with partners to gather accurate specifications for new enhancements and applications.
* Maintain knowledge of application security best practices and modern vulnerabilities
  


**Qualifications:**
-------------------



* B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field.
* 10+ years of experience in software development.
* Experience in Nuclear Applications Functional Design.
* Experience with Windows socket, TCP & UDP socket programming.
* Experience in Application Builder, raphical user interface in Java, parsing XML documents, Modbus/OPC protocols, Cisco switch configuration, Wireshark troubleshooting, Matlab/Simulink desired.
* Experience writing requirements specifications, test procedures, user's guides and test reports.
* Experience troubleshooting issues with users.
#LI-Hybrid

  


### **Apply Today!**



Welcome with your application including CV and cover letter. We interview candidates on a continuous basis, so please send in your application as soon as possible!


**Security clearance is carried out as part of the recruitment process.**



For more information about the role, please contact the hiring manager, Tommy Brandt, Nordic CIS Engineering Manager, tommy.brandt@westinghouse.com.

  


### **Union Agreement**



This role belongs to the union agreement Teknikavtalet.


**Union representatives:**



Akademikerförening på Westinghouse (AFW): Anna Lundgren, +46 21 347825, AFW@westinghouse.com



Unionen: Maria Gunnarsson, +46 21 347 595, gunnarmm@westinghouse.com



IF Metall: Zlatko Grbic, +46 732 367 035, grbicz@westinghouse.com

**We offer**
------------



At Westinghouse, we offer an inspiring work environment in a high-tech industry. You will be a part of a network of global experts from several different areas and we offer great opportunities for competence development and career growth, both in Sweden and abroad. As a member of our team, you will work together with engaged colleagues and be a part of an environment that is both challenging and supportive. Many of our positions are based in activity-based environments which enables a flexible workplace.



At Westinghouse, we have a strong safety culture.



Westinghouse is an employer that treats everyone equally.

  


**Some of the benefits employees in the Sweden can expect:**

  

* Wellness Allowance
* Flexible pay opportunities via our Benefit portal
* Work hour reduction (ATF) and occupational pension (ITP)
* ASB Insurance: compensation for the cost of health care, dental care hearing aids, glasses and more
* Employee Assistance Program: confidential counseling and resources for employees, eligible dependents, and household members
* Employee Referral Program, potential for employees to earn a monetary award for referring other qualified candidates to Westinghouse

title: Portfolio Strategy Professional
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity:**


Power Conversion Solutions (PCS) is a newly formed Global Product Group (GPG) within Hitachi Energy, created by combining the energy storage system expertise with the power conversion product business. PCS aims to become a high-performing, successful, and attractive partner for developers, IPPs, and integrators by offering an unparalleled package of products, services, and software. Our mission is to drive profitable growth and deliver high-value automation and digital solutions to our customers.


The Portfolio Strategy Professional will play a critical role in the newly formed Power Conversion Solutions (PCS) organization.


This position is responsible for driving the strategy work across the product portfolio and identifies, evaluates and negotiates, new sales, new product and marketing growth opportunities across multiple of the following areas: Business cases, Pricing Strategy, Product portfolio Strategy, New Product Development, Localization and Market Strategies. The work includes supporting strategic partnerships including financial arrangements, customer sharing, and intellectual property rights. Works with the Product cost structure and investments into the product portfolio. Prioritizing and tracking investments across new product development initiatives


This position is based in Solna, Sweden.

**How you will make and impact:**

* Drive the portfolio strategy work in tight collaboration with the respective product managers and the PCS management team.
* Develop and track the overall local/regional pricing strategy and keep an overall portfolio view of product profitability.
* Develop business cases both for new product development but also for expansion of business/manufacturing footprint.
* Collaborate with engineering and product development teams to ensure the overall strategy of the business is reached and clearly implemented across the development activities.
* Be the owner of the key business assumptions and references assuring there is a common base and approach to across the product development activities and targets (volumes, prices, compliance etc.)
* Monitor and analyze performance metrics, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions as needed to optimize the portfolio and ongoing development activities.
* Support key strategic initiatives across the business and support the needed analysis up until an investment decision.
* Participate in the development of new offerings and business models to meet evolving customer needs and market trends.
* Support the sales team in promoting and selling offerings, providing portfolio expertise and articulate customer specific value propositions.

 **Your background:**

* Master’s degree in engineering, business administration, or a related field preferred.
* Minimum of 6 years of experience in a strategy role for engineering companies, preferably in the power conversion, battery energy storage or renewable energy industry.
* Experience with digital and automation business models and value propositions within the broader renewable energy industry.
* Experience in developing and managing strategy development and implementation as well as generating and owning the business case models
* Strong business case & strategy skills, with a proven track record of building and performing investments into new products and business growth
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with customers and internal stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities.

**What we offer:**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

 **More about us**


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with. Embrace Diversity and Innovation and join our team at Hitachi Energy! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis and might result with the advertisement being unposted with short notice, so don’t delay – apply today!

  

Recruiting Manager, Anton Ekeström, anton.ekestrom@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Adnan Glibo, +46 107-38 63 78; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Karin Ulvemark, +46 107-38 51 42. All other questions can be directed to Lead Christian Falevik, christian.falevik@hitachienergy.com.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: C++ Developer with Frontend Experience
description:
We are looking for a Senior C++ developer with frontend experience. It’s a big plus if you are interested in working with games.
   

  

**Start:** 
 ASAP or August
   

  

**Length:** 
 18 months
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm on-site minimum 2-3 days per week
   

  

 As a member of the design system team, you will have the unique challenge of creating and maintaining a scalable, performant, and stable architecture for our Ore UI system used in the current edition.
   

  

 By joining the Ore UI Framework team, you will find an environment that enables you to leverage your knowledge and values to maintain and evolve a healthy and collaborative culture as we grow.
   

  

 Some of your tasks will be:
   

  

* Work on the game edition to develop the systems that drive Ore UI, using C++
* Collaborate with C++ developers and TypeScript/React developers on building new UI and making API decisions.
* Work with designers and producers to solve user needs.
* Maintain integration between our game and top-of-the-line 3rd party UI technology.
* Collaborate with other teams to drive UI cohesion throughout the game.
* Improve ways of working and technical best practices within the team.
* Coach members within and outside of the team on best practices in software development.
* Balance performance, user experience, and developer experience in every decision.
* Ensure high levels of quality, for example by utilizing good API design and test automation.


**What you will bring to the team:**
* Proficiency with C++ (C++17 and C++20).
* Experience working with legacy code.
* Understanding of and interest in rendering and how graphics implementations are made.
* Strong communication and problem-solving skills, as well as a natural collaborator and team player.
* Passion for supporting and understanding how the product teams using Ore UI can work efficiently with the framework we provide for them.

title: Data Engineer

description:
**Data Engineer to Advanced Analytics and AI Department**
 Join our Clients Advanced Analytics & AI team as a Platform Engineer! You’ll build and operate cutting-edge data and machine learning capabilities, playing a crucial role in driving our business forward with data-driven insights.
   

  

 their team
   

  

  

  

**About the Team** 
  

  

  

  

 The client’s Advanced Analytics & AI team develops advanced analytics solutions and AI applications that enhance products, services, and decision-making. The team leverages statistics, machine learning, and modern technologies across areas such as personalization, product development, and business strategy.
   

  

 They work in a cross-functional environment characterized by collaboration, innovation, and initiative.
   

  

  

  

**About the Role** 
  

  

  

  

 As a Platform Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining hybrid data and ML platforms, both on-premises and in the cloud. You will work closely with data and ML engineers to ensure robust pipelines and the successful deployment of models into production.
   

  

 wThe role requires a strong understanding of DevOps principles, CI/CD, and will be working in a Linux environment. You should be comfortable working in the terminal and have a passion for improving platforms and processes.
   

  

  

  

**Required** 
  

  

* rMinimum 4 years of professional record as a Data Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or ML Engineer
* Solid expertise in software development and system design
* Expertise building data pipelines using tools such as dbt, Prefect, and Spark
* Strong skills in Python and SQL
* Expertise with containerized development in Linux environments
* Familiarity with test-driven development
* Expertise deploying ML models to production (MLOps)
* Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform and Ansible
* Basic Swedish language skills are a plus, but not required


  

  

**Desired Competencies** 
  

  

* Strong planning and coordination skills
* Deep technical expertise
* Solid Linux knowledge
* Understanding of agents and access management
* Skills with containers and CI/CD pipelines
* Broad technical knowledge and fast learning ability
* Data engineering skills including orchestration and model management
* Cloud expertise in Azure is highly desirable, especially with Databricks


  

  

  

  

**Job Title:** 
 Data Engineer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Contract
   

  

 Trading as TEKsystems. Aston Carter International Ltd UK Filial. Drottninggatan 27,111 51 Stockholm, Sweden. No. 516404-0163. title: Calibration & Test Engineer – Automotive
description:
🚛
 **Calibration Engineer – HVAC Systems (Automotive)**
 Do you have a passion for
 **system calibration** 
 and want to work hands-on with
 **thermal comfort systems in vehicles** 
 ? We are now looking for a
 **Calibration Engineer** 
 specialized in
 **HVAC systems for driver cabins** 
 . The focus of this assignment is on
 **calibrating heating and cooling systems** 
 to ensure performance, energy efficiency, and comfort in all climate conditions.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role where you will work closely with development engineers and use tools like
 **ETAS INCA** 
 to fine-tune system behavior across a wide range of operating scenarios. You will also take part in test campaigns to verify and validate your calibrations in real-world environments.
   

  

 🔧
 **About the Assignment**
 You will join a skilled development team working on
 **climate control systems in heavy-duty vehicles** 
 . Your main responsibility will be
 **HVAC calibration** 
 – from early tuning to validation in test vehicles – ensuring optimal performance of heating, ventilation, and cooling systems. The role also involves test planning, sensor setup, and performance evaluation.
   

  

 💼
 **Key Responsibilities**
* Calibrate HVAC systems in trucks with a focus on thermal comfort and energy efficiency.
* Use ETAS INCA and related tools for calibration, data logging, and real-time adjustments.
* Plan and execute test drives and climate chamber tests (including winter/summer campaigns).
* Set up measurement equipment and sensors in test vehicles.
* Analyze calibration data and adjust parameters for optimal results.
* Work closely with HVAC developers, test engineers, and diagnostic teams.
* Document calibration strategies, findings, and recommended improvements.


 🧠
 **Your Profile**
* Solid hands-on experience in calibrating HVAC or thermal systems, preferably in automotive applications.
* Skilled in tools such as:
+ ETAS INCA
+ Vector CANoe, X-com, Gadget

* Comfortable working with diagnostics, system understanding, and parameter tuning.
* Strong analytical mindset – experience with MATLAB or similar tools is an advantage.
* Experience from the automotive industry is a strong plus.
* You are structured, independent, and proactive in solving technical challenges.
* B driver’s license required; C license (heavy truck) is a strong advantage.


 📍
 **Location:** 
 Södertälje
   

  

 🗓️
 **Start Date:** 
 September 2025
   

  

 🌍
 **Travel:** 
 Occasional trips within Sweden and abroad for test campaigns

title: System Design Engineer
description:
**About the job** 




 We develop and manufacture turnkey energy storage solutions, based on lithium-ion battery technology. Our goal is to engineer technology that both stores and optimizes energy as we shift towards more efficient energy usage and renewable energy sources on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with exceptional engineers, scientists, developers and more to pave the way for the next big leap in the energy industry through our battery energy storage and optimization systems.
 



  





**Location:** 
 Polarium HQ (Stockholm) and Tomteboda (Solna).
 



  





**Main Responsibilities:** 




 As a System Engineer, your responsibilities will include:
 



 Designing technical solutions that integrate both hardware and software components
 



  





 Documenting, analyzing, and tracing requirements from customers, standards, and internal stakeholders
 



  





 Leading or supporting certification efforts (e.g. CE, UL, EMC, safety), including preparation of technical documentation
 



  





 Writing and reviewing technical documentation such as product requirements, test specifications, system descriptions, and user manuals
 



  





 Conducting risk assessments
 



  





 Developing certification strategies and corresponding documentation
 



  





**Qualifications and Experience** 




 Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in a relevant engineering field
 



  





 Strong communication skills and ability to manage external contacts with confidence
 



  





 Ability to act independently and determine methods and procedures for new or unique assignments
 



  





 Proactive and highly motivated, with a strong sense of ownership
 



  





 Ability to comprehend and clearly communicate complex ideas in English
 



  





 Capacity to maintain a holistic perspective while remaining attentive to detail
 



  





 Structured and analytical mindset
 



  





 Self-motivated with strong collaboration abilities
 



  





 Willingness to travel occasionally
 



  





 Fluent in both English and Swedish, written and spoken
 



  





 Kindly submit your application through the provided apply button in the advertisement on our careers page, as we are unable to accept any applications via email in compliance with the GDPR regulations.
 



  





 At Polarium, creating change in the energy industry starts with our team. We believe a diverse workplace brings creativity, innovation and better represents our customers, and the many communities they serve, around the world. A positive work-life balance is what supercharges our teamwork and a sustainable personal journey throughout our careers.
 



  





 Since Polarium launched in 2015, we’ve been on a mission to redesign the energy industry. We’re unlocking the massive potential of energy storage systems through our wide range of intelligent and digital services. Our passion for solving challenges is what drives our next generation of premium energy storage products in use on all continents and in all climate zones. Today, we power businesses, optimize energy usage, and reduce carbon dioxide emissions to create a cleaner future in energy.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!
 



  





**About the company** 




 Building a Sustainable Future Together
 



  





 We are a Swedish company dedicated to providing the best-performing, safe, and sustainable energy storage solutions built on lithium-ion technology. Today, our market-leading solutions are in use on all continents and in all climate zones. We ensure that the flow of energy never stops, while enabling our customers to reduce their energy costs and carbon footprint.
 



  





 Do you share our vision for a smart and sustainable future? Join our team!
